        • pycheron.psd.noise.getNoise

    pycheron.psd.noise.getNoise¶

    getNoise(psd_list, evalresp=None, logger=None)[source]¶

    Uses the snclq identifier associated with the first PSD in the list to obtain instrument correction information at the specified frequencies from the getEvalresp web service if instrument correction information is not supplied as an argument. This correction is applied to every PSD in the list and the now corrected PSD values are returned as a matrix.

    Parameters:
    • psd_list (list) – list of PSDs, use pycheron.psdList.psdList function
    • evalresp (numpy.ndarray) – array of freq, amp, phase information matching output of client.evalresp. Either obtained from client.evalresp if None, or can be user supplied as long as array matches output of client.evalresp.
    • logger (pycheron.util.logger.Logger) – logger object
    Returns:

    • List of frequencies for associated psd
    • List of noise matrices for each corrected PSD (for each trace of stream)
    • Modified input list (psd_list), will be the same length if no stations are popped, otherwise may be a different length.
    Return type:

    • list
    • list
    • list

    Example

    # import psdList since psdList is input to getNoise
from pycheron.psd.psdList import psdList
from pycheron.psd.noise.getNoise import getNoise

# test data
data = 'test/test_data/7a_cabn_bhe.884965.tar.mseed'

# reading in stream
st = obspy.read(data)

# getting noise to input into function
# creating list of psds, this is a REQUIRMENT as the psdStatistic takes in a psdList
psds = psdList(st)
# Get instrument corrected psds
f,n,psd = getNoise(psds)
